CatDescriptText: Mr. Jesse Hurt, 2525 Centre Avenue was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 11, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that permitting children to work after school hours is detrimental to their general welfare--Health, school, and recreational time, etc?" answer reads: "I don't think so. However, it depends on the type of work which I think should be suitable.  Some of the work, like the heavy type, is no good for the kids, while other jobs like soda fountain work, delivering papers, and working at a drug store, are all right."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Jesse Hurt wearing dark plaid jacket, holding pipe in mouth, seated on wicker chair on stoop with railing and door with window and mail slot
